With blinding speed, she cocks her hand back and SLAPS him. Hard. He doesn’t react to the slap. Her anger mounts and she slaps him AGAIN. Soon her anger turns to despair and she begins to cry.  57. Gus tries to comfort her trying to wrap his arms around her. She tries to get away from him pushing back but he overpowers her. With closed fists, she beats at his chest, but her energy’s waning.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You did this!!! She finally falls into his arms, sobbing into his chest. Without a word, Gus lets Anna take her anger out until she’s spent.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck you!!! With a delicate touch we’ve never seen from Gus, he holds her face into his hands. He wipes the smeared mascara running from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) I won’t let anything happen to you again. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I promise. Her anger subsides. Anna falls into his arms, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gus lays on the mattress, awake. He strokes her hair. Anna is curled up next to him grabbing onto him like a security blanket, sleeping. She stirs in her sleep. She gasps and sits up, breathing hard. She wakes from a nightmare, looks around the room. Gus sits up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I’m right here. You were having a nightmare. She looks over to him, touches his face to reassure herself. Satisfied, she shifts and lies on his lap. He strokes her hair.  58.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep. Gus keeps stroking her hair to try and soothe her. She pushes his hand away, roughly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Don’t. Gus puts his hand back on her hair. She tries to push him away again. Gus catches her hands and holds them like a vice. Then he releases them gently and puts his hand back on her hair and strokes it again. Anna looks away and lies down facing away from him. Tears stream down from her face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t make it stop. There’s a brief silence except for Anna’s sniffling. She wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was fourteen. My grandpa was a preacher. I was his perfect granddaughter. Always attended Sunday School at the church... She struggles to continue - she needs to let this out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One Sunday after class, the teacher asked me to stay late to help him clean up. She gets choked up in tears.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His hands were so strong. I couldn’t stop him. I tried... Gus closes his eyes pained for her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I told my grandpa, he just looked at me in this way. Like I did something wrong. Like it was my fault. He said he would take care of it, but he did nothing. (beat ) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So every Sunday I had to face this monster and I couldn’t say a word. He’d just smile and act like nothing happened. I’d see him places, around town, always with that same, sick smile.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You’re safe here. She breaks down, sobbing. As Gus holds her, he can’t see the concern that slowly washes over her face. It’s clear she doesn’t believe him.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Gus wakes still in his bloodied clothes. He rubs his eyes and sees that Anna is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gus is wiping down her table. He gathers some loose change, Everything is in its place and organized. After wiping the table, Gus inspects his work.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gus opens the small refrigerator and peers in. He takes a survey of what’s in there, but there’s not much. He closes the door and thinks for a second before walking back to the table. He looks into the bowl and dips his finger inside, pushing the money around, counting it in his head. He pauses for a beat and thinks for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus walks out of the bodega with a bag full of groceries. He pauses outside as he walks by the fresh flower stand. He stares at the flower and at the woman cutting the stems off the flowers.  60. He reaches into his pocket and counts what money he has left. He looks over the flowers and spots a pretty but inexpensive bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANNA’S APARTMENT - EVENING Gus stares at her small dining table. The table is set for a dinner he’s cooked. The flowers have been placed into a makeshift vase in the middle of the setting. He goes over to a basket near the entry way and grabs some matchbooks. He takes one and lights candles, tosses the matchbooks aside. He looks at everything, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ANNA’S APARTMENT - LATER The candles have burned down. One has blown out completely. Gus sits in one of the chairs staring at the clock on the wall. Anna’s late. Frustrated, he walks towards the window and looks outside. After a few moments, he comes back to the table. He notices the blown out candle and goes for the matchbooks. He lights the candle and takes a look at the matchbook cover. It’s a picture of a cue ball with the number 13. On the opposite end, the words: CLUB 13. He looks over to the other matchbooks and they are all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus walks up to small unassuming doors and a large glass window. It’s more a neighborhood bar than an actual club, but it’s got music blasting inside and it’s packed. Gus peers in through the window and sees Anna inside. She has a drink in hand and flirtatiously leans against a wall as a YOUNG MAN stands over her, his hand bracing the wall. The young man leans in and kisses her neck. She turns away, sees Gus staring at her through the window. She looks away from Gus and pulls the Young Man closer to her, giving him a deep long kiss. He’s seen enough. Gus charges through the doors.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus plows through the mostly young crowd. He sticks out like a sore thumb. He pushes people aside brusquely until he finds Anna in the back corner with the young man. She looks briefly at Gus then tries to ignore him. Gus moves the Young Man aside and takes Anna by her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I needed a drink. The Young Man has spilled his drink on himself, looks at Gus perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: This guy bothering you? Gus whirls around and looks at the Young Man with an angry but focused expression.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Leave. He turns from him, in condescending fashion, trains his attention back to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go. Anna rips her hand from his.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere. Leave me alone. She moves towards the young man and wraps her arm around him. She looks straight into Gus’ eyes and then kisses the Young Man in front of him, her hand trailing down to his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: (shit-eating grin) I think she likes me. Gus grabs onto Anna once again and drags her with him. She tries to fight but can’t free herself. The Young Man grabs onto Gus’ shoulder and turns him around.  62. YOUNG MAN (CONT’D) Listen, you old fuck... BIG MISTAKE. Without letting go of Anna’s hand. Gus swings at the Young Man. CRUNCH!!! Gus connects with the Young Man’s nose and blood flies everywhere. The Young Man staggers back and falls to the ground. He grabs Anna, but she fights him tooth and nail, makes a scene. SECURITY shows up. A BOUNCER pushes up on Gus, but - BAM! - he gets a face full of fist. She SCREAMS. Gus drags Anna out, almost carrying her out the door The crowd keeps away from Gus, not wanting to receive his wrath, while others go in the aid of the Young Man, whose face is covered in his own blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus carries Anna out the door in a giant bear hug. She kicks and screams.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Let me go, you asshole! Gus puts her down.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Stop screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You want to act like a little girl, I’m going to treat you like one. Anna struggles a bit more then realizes it’s no use.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You’re hurting me. Gus puts her down and but keeps hold of her hand. He walks down the street pulling her behind him.  63. INT. ANNA’S APARTMENT Gus drags Anna inside and pushes her into the apartment roughly. Anna almost falls by the force. She comes inside the apartment and looks around. She stares at the set-up in the dining table. Gus stands there embarrassed by everything. She looks over to him. He doesn’t answer. She walks over to the table, then suddenly swipes the setting off with her hand sending dishes to the floor. Gus looks at her stunned and hurt - it’s not the reaction he was hoping for.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask for this. She takes a snort of cocaine. Gus walks over to her

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: How long you been doing that shit? Anna takes a swing at him but he catches her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out. I want you to leave. She tries to push him towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just like everyone else. You get your fix then your gone! She hits him with her fists. One lands cutting Gus on the lip. He tries to catch her flailing arms as she begins to attack. Tears are streaming from her face. Gus finally grabs hold of her hands.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: That was the past. That’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It never changes. She struggles again but Gus restrains her. In the heat of the struggle, Gus grabs her face and kisses her. She resists. For a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.  64. Then the passion takes over. Soon they are grasping at each others’ bodies. Taking off clothes while their lips devour each other. This release is heated and just about as violent as their struggle. They tumble towards the mattress. Their bodies cling to each other in desperation. Undressed, Gus lays on top of Anna kissing her breasts and moving up her neck until finding her lips. Anna moans in ecstasy. She grabs his head forcefully and feeds him with a kiss. They begin to make love. CLOSE on Anna's face - a cross between pain and pleasure. She bites her lip to keep from screaming, as Gus enters her. They make passionate love, that's mixed with fear, violence and love.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna lie naked in each other’s arms. He strokes her arm gently. She closes her eyes. Bliss.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna take a bath together, take turns soaping each other up. She splashes him, LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: The drone of a hairdryer. Anna sits on the floor, head bowed as Gus kneels behind her blow-drying her hair with one hand, brushing it out with the other. Finally, he turns the machine off. As he continues brushing, she lets off a satisfied sigh.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Anna leans back against Gus. Suddenly, she looks at him. Her face grows serious. Anna gets up, goes to the closet. She pulls out a shoebox, brings it over to the bed.  65.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Something I should’ve done a long time ago. She opens the box and we see that it’s filled with mementos. Pictures of old boyfriends, love letters, poems.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I held on to these for so long. She grabs a pair of scissors, starts cutting pictures in half, throws them in the trash. Gus looks at a poem, but she snaps it out of his hand, tosses it in the trash. She cuts and cuts and cuts. Picture after picture falls into the trash, ex-boyfriend after ex-boyfriend. She takes the whole box and turns it over, dumping everything into the trash. A total purging. Anna finds this somewhat exhilarating. Gus looks down at a picture. Something about the face pulls him closer. The color begins to drain from his face.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: One that Anna didn’t cut yet. A familiar face. He has his arms around Anna, their hair mussed. GUS staggers back in shock. He looks at Anna as though she just plunged a knife into his belly. ANNA (CONT’D) What? She goes to him, takes a look at the picture. Gus can’t look at her. He shoves the picture back

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with growing alarm) That’s Steven. We just went on a few dates.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It’s HIM.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Who? Anna is starting to panic.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Now he looks at her full on. His gaze overpowering, condemning.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: How did you meet?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Online. BEAT. Then the inevitable moment of dread-

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Did you FUCK him? She looks away, eyes averted. He takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you still talk?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Online or-

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes fucking online!

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Log on. See if he’s there.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: Anna sits in front of the computer screen. Gus paces behind. ON SCREEN: Her buddy list displays the name “Evergreen”.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He’s on.  67.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Gus...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Talk to him goddammit! She clicks on “Evergreen” and an Instant Messenger window pops open. Immediately, Evergreen types: “Hello Gus. Was she good?” Gus PUNCHES the wall, losing his mind. GUS (CONT’D) He watches my every move.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I can’t do this right now. Gus stares at the screen name, pacing. Another message follows: “You have three days.” Evergreen disappears from her buddy list. On screen it says: “Evergreen has logged off.” Gus paces once again. Anna feels terrible, starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Can’t fucking believe this! But his words only make it worse. She can’t stop now. He grabs her up in a tight embrace, almost too tight. Anna sobs into his strong arms. She feels both comfort and uncertainty. Security mixed with abject fear.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MIKE’S OFFICE - NIGHT Mike sits behind a big desk. In his hand he holds the picture of Steven. Only now, Anna has been cut out.  68. Gus and Anna sit opposite, studying Mike’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Someone’s been cut out.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Nevermind that. Look at the face. Mike stares hard.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: And you say his name is Steve?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Steven. Last name, Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Riordan, Riordan... (beat ) I don’t know this guy. (beat ) Hey wait, remember Telly from high school? He runs a software company that finds people online. Maybe we could- Gus stops in his tracks - a moment of realization.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: His screen name’s Evergreen if that helps?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Evergreen. .? Gus slowly turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Mike...high school. Gus and Mike look at each other, a sudden realization.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Are you shitting me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Mike and I went to a school called the Evergreen Academy. I transferred to St. Joe’s my sophomore year. It can’t bea coincidence.  69. They sit in stunned silence. A connection has been made.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t remember any Steven Riordan. Then again, I can barely remember college.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We need a yearbook.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me. I lost mine years ago. Gus gets up-

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I’m going down there.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It’s two hours away.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Give me your keys. I’m borrowing your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives. Leather seats, moon roof, the whole nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives up to the high school, parks in front. Anna gets out, stretches her legs looking around. The school is a cluster of old brick buildings surrounded by trees and greenery. Old school - old money. Gus looks around at the campus, the wheels of memory turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sits with Gus, flipping through a yearbook. A LIBRARIAN scrutinizes them. He gets to the ‘R’s. But there is no Steven.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: No Steven Riordan in any grade.  70.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s not his real name. We should just look at the faces. He slides the book aside, frustrated. He looks out the window. Meanwhile, Anna opens the book again, flips to thru the women’s section.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: High school was a prison I left and never looked back. Now I’m forced to look, but I can’t see a thing. What crime committed here could deserve such a punishment? An envelope falls out, Gus picks it up. It’s a coupon for a hair salon called Susan’s Hair Creations. He looks at it for a beat before pocketing it.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the girls’ section.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I know. I saw something... She stops at a name: Caroline Riordan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caroline Riordan. The name strikes a chord with Gus. His mind races, he looks around as if the walls are closing in on him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you remember her? He looks out the window to a kiosk in front of the school. A GIRL stands there, holding her book bag, waiting to be picked up. Gus stares at her, something about the visual brings him back to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strikingly beautiful girl with long brunette hair and piercing blue eyes stands by the same kiosk, years earlier. This is CAROLINE RIORDAN, 17. She looks around the empty parking lot waiting for someone.  71. YOUNG GUS stands nearby on his bike, smoking a cigarette. He looks at his watch, then glances up at Caroline. She flashes a quick smile then turns away, coyly. Gus stares at her, awestruck. Slowly, he approaches. She senses him coming, tries to look busy by looking at the kiosk, full of flyers and announcements. Gus clears his throat. She is looking at a flyer. CLOSE ON the flyer - an audition for a play: MEDEA. GUS (cont’d) You thinking about auditioning? Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should. I bet you’1l get it. Caroline smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? How about you? Gus scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Me? I was in the sixth grade production of ‘The Sound of Music’ and I forgot all the songs except one: ‘Climb Every Mountain.’

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: That’s my favorite song from my favorite musical. (beat ) I think actors are really cool.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Why would I wanna be cool? Caroline looks at the cigarette. Gus looks at it too, which he flicks to the floor and stamps with his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re new here, right? My name’s Gus. In the distance, a teenager stands looking at them. STEVEN RIORDAN, 16, quiet and unassuming, with a camera strapped around his neck.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: There’s my brother. I gotta go. She heads towards her brother. Then pauses and turns to him. CAROLINE (cont’d) (CONT’D) (calls out) Caroline. My name’s Caroline Riordan. She flashes him a devastating smile before joining her brother and walking away. Gus watches her go. He catches Steven looking back glaring at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives along the streets towards the quiet town of Evergreen. His mind races. Anna sits next to him staring at the sights outside.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So what was she like? Gus ponders the question but doesn’t answer. Outside, a school bus drives down on the opposite side of the street. Gus looks at it briefly. A boy on a bike follows behind the slow moving bus, struggling to keep up. It’s Young Gus. Gus looks at Young Gus pedalling away through his rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Gus pedals furiously as the school bus makes several stops. Young Gus cuts through a small park area - a short cut. The bus stops and Caroline gets off the bus. She walks across the street to a PUBLIC BUS stop where she meets up with her brother Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The public bus makes a stop and Caroline and Steven get off the bus. In the distance, Young Gus watches from his bike. Caroline and Steven walk towards their home. Steven reaches for his sister’s hand to hold it. Caroline shakes free from his grasp. Gus watches this interaction. That was odd. He starts pedalling slowly, making sure he’s undetected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low income neighborhood. The street is lined with small homes that have not been maintained. Caroline and Steven walk into their house - paint peeling, grass overgrown, junk piled everywhere. Young Gus rides his bike up and stand behind a tree watching the house, hoping to get a glimpse of Caroline. Suddenly, from inside the house, through a window he sees a figure of an older man, their FATHER. He looks unkempt and scraggly, his shirt unbuttoned. He’s screaming at - Caroline enters the window, fear in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Don’t you walk away from me. Her father grabs her hand and pushes her close to him. She pushes him back, struggling to get away. He slaps her hard. Caroline manages to get free and runs out of the house. She runs to the side of the house away and leans up against the wall crying, her hand feeling her stinging face. Steven runs out looking for her. He approaches slowly. He goes up to her and hugs her. She cries into his shoulder. He holds her face in his hands. He leans in...for a kiss. He’s about to kiss her on the lips, but she turns the last minute and he gives her a tender kiss on the cheek.  74. Gus watches on. There’s something unnerving about their interaction - something wrong. He feels like he’s witnessed something taboo, presses against a tree to keep from being seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image of Young Gus appears as a reflection on a store front window that disappears as Present Day Gus stares at it. He takes out the flyer for the hair salon and walks down the street filled with quaint stores and boutiques. He looks back towards his car, sees Anna sitting there looking out the window at him. He looks back down the street. Across from where he stands he spots a small hair salon with a sign reading: SUSAN'S HAIR CREATIONS. From a nearby coffee shop, SUSAN ANDRUCKI, 40s, exits with coffee in her hand. She saunters through the shop looking at her hair through a store window’s reflection. She waves at other store owners and passerby’s before entering the shop. Gus crosses the street heading for the salon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan sits in a salon chair sipping her coffee talking on the phone. Gus enters. Susan swivels towards him not looking up, still talking. SUSAN (cont'd) (to Gus) I’ll be just a sec. Gus clears his throat. SUSAN (cont’d) (CONT’D) (on the phone) Uh huh, uh huh. You said it.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Susan Andrucki. She looks up, doesn’t recognize him...but familiarity begins to creep up on her.  75. SUSAN (cont'd) (on the phone) Dana, I gotta call you back. She hangs up the phone. SUSAN (cont’d) (CONT’D) I haven’t been Susan Andrucki for a long time...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Gus sits in the salon chair staring at his reflection as Susan cuts his hair. He focuses on her mouth, seemingly moving a mile a minute. We catch phrases here and there. SUSAN (cont’d) (CONT’D) Susan Barker. That’s my married name. (another ) You were always such a troublemaker back then. But look at you now. Time’s been good to you. (another ) You better tell that jerk to call me back. I spent good money to find him on the internet. Susan runs her fingers flirtatiously through his hair. She walks behind him and unbuttons her top button on her blouse. She circles him and leans over, letting him get an eyeful of her full breasts. Gus just stares at her expressionless, looks beyond her to the mirror. Gus watches his reflection as he gets groomed, looking better and cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Do you remember Caroline Riordan? Susan sighs, realizing his disinterest.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Caroline Riordan. .?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Drama club.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: God that name takes me back.  76.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You remember? She nods solemnly, affected by the name. Gus looks at himself in the mirror, the haircut making him look younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Young Gus, staring at his reflection in a mirror mounted on his locker door. Kids stream through the corridor all around him. Something in the mirror catches his eye: CAROLINE, approaching from the end of the hall behind Gus. He shuts the locker and turns around, looking at Caroline. He’s taken with her simple beauty, her modesty.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Transfer student. Got in ona scholarship, which basically meant she was White Trash with a brain. Pretty girl, but everybody knew where she was from. What she really was.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What else? A slut... But he notices something else, too. Other kids are gawking at her, leering. She’s being ridiculed. Caroline pretends not to notice, acts as though it doesn’t get to her. Yet still, a hint of pain and embarrassment is evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan stares at Gus via the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Everyone tried to forget after what happened. It’s funny how we remember what we only want to remember. What happened to her was awful.  She stops. 77.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I don’t remember much.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That’s right, you transferred. (beat ) They found her body washed up on the river. Drowned herself. Jumped maybe...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Who really knew? There were so many rumors around. She was pregnant, she didn’t know who the father was... (pauses ) There was one rumor... Gus looks at her. She makes a face. SUSAN (cont’d) (CONT’D) Look, it was high school we were all cruel. Out to save our own skins.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Do you remember anything else about her...or her brother? His tone becomes more urgent. Susan’s starting to tire with this cold. Gus’s eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trip down memory lane. Her expression goes

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go ask the person that started all the rumors.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Your old buddy. Mike. widen, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus paces in front of the hair salon, dialing a number on his cell phone.  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is in the middle of a party, doing a line of coke. Pretty, scantily clad women are everywhere. He pulls one onto his lap, wraps his arms around her waist. Mike’s phone rings. He looks at his phone, ignores the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus hits ‘end’ on the cell phone, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna's car returns to the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus parks the car and takes out the keys. He turns to towards Anna and sees her curled up on the seat sleeping. She looks so peaceful that he decides not to wake her. He quietly slips out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus walks through campus looking at the empty buildings trying to gain some clarity. He stops and looks at a building in the distance and is drawn to it. He makes his way towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus pushes the doors open and enters the dark building. He goes to the back wall to turn on the lights. The theater comes to life as the lights flicker on. Gus walks down the aisles and takes a seat in the middle of the empty theater. Frustrated he buries his head in his hands. He closes his eyes, and lets the memories take over. When he looks at the stage again he sees...  79. Two young boys. A young Mike and a young Gus smoke cigarettes on stage carrying paint and brushes. It's a flashback but the present Gus exists in the same space. Gus quietly looks on remembering.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Mike and Gus paint a backdrop, surrounded by cans and brushes. As Gus works he smokes a lit cigarette half- dangling out of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Can you fucking believe this? Drama Club sucks. It’s like being in Special Ed.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GUS
dialogues.text: You should feel at home then. Mike gives Gus the finger, steps back to admire his paint job. Gus flicks his cigarette on the ground, stamps it out with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know how I let you talk me into this. All for some stupid chick.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GUS
dialogues.text: Oh you should talk. At least I don’t do someone else’s homework to get to second base.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: It was third base. And believe me, it was worth it. Gus picks up his brush again and starts painting. YOUNG MIKE (CONT’D) (looks at watch) Shit. I told Susan I’d meet her after band practice. He drops his brush in a bucket, wiping his hands off.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GUS
dialogues.text: We got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Just this once, man. I think we’re going all the way soon.  80.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GUS
dialogues.text: You wish. Present day Gus watches young Mike exit. He then returns his gaze on the young Gus on stage. YOUNG GUS (cont’d) (CONT’D) Asshole. Young Gus looks around the empty theater then looks up at the lights. He sighs and disappears behind the stage. Gus watches his young self disappear behind the stage. Curious, he gets up and follows. He runs up on stage and looks up at the catwalk overlooking the theater, sees Young Gus's shadows. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Present day Gus carefully walks up the creaking structure, careful not to disturb his memory. He sees young Gus perched above looking over the stage. Young Gus rests his elbows over the catwalk ledge and looks around. He makes sure he's alone and pulls out a joint from his pocket. YOUNG GUS (cont’d) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humming ) I think we're alone now... He puts the joint to his lips and is about to light it when... A figure walks onto the stage. Both Young Gus and Present Day Gus retract into the darkness careful not to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Caroline walks onto the stage. Both Young and Present Day Gus peek over the catwalk, catching a glimpse of her. She walks in the middle of the stage and looks out to the audience. She likes it up here. She begins to recite lines.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Come flame of the sky...  81. She stops, not liking the delivery. She closes her eyes to get into the moment.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Young Gus looks at her and smiles, enchanted. He's falling for her. Present Day Gus looks at himself, empathetic.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Caroline takes a deep breath, starts over. CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont’d) Come, flame by sky, Pierce through my head! What do I gain from living any longer? Oh how I hate living! I want to end my life, leave it behind, and die. She's good.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Young Gus is drawn to her, emerges from the shadows. He wants to go down, but suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Another figure emerges from the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Young Gus withdraws back into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Steven Riordan joins his sister. A camera slung around his neck. He takes a picture of her CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont'd) C'mon, Steven. I'm trying to practice. He takes another shot. She's annoyed but loves the attention of the camera. CAROLINE (CONT'D) (cont’d) Go away! I need to learn my lines. He takes another shot, then places the camera down.  82.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: What madness is this? The bed you long for - Is it what others shrink from? Is it death that you demand? While reciting lines, Steven circles her taking pictures. She laughs at him.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You missed a few lines.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: See? You know it. You don't need to practice. He keeps taking shots, getting closer to her. She's getting into it, posing and acting coy.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Stop... He is only a few inches from her. He stops taking shots and places the camera down. He looks at his beautiful sister. She gazes back at him.

dialogues.speaker: CATWALK
dialogues.text: Young Gus watches the interaction between Caroline and her brother with morbid fascination. Steven leans into his sister for a kiss. It looks like their lips will meet but she pushes him away. She laughs and runs behind the stage.

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Caroline and Steven play a flirtatious game, running after each other. Steven traps her against a wall, holds his arms out pinning him in between.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: No one's here.  83. She ducks under his arms and runs to a corner and sits on a desk. Steven approaches her slowly. He takes the camera and begins to take pictures again, the flash explodes with each shot. She loves the attention of the camera. She leans back on her hands, and lets him take pictures of her. It's as if the camera is making love to her. Steven finally let's go of the camera. He's directly in front of her, between her legs. He touches her thigh. STEVEN (CONT’D) But I’m here. I’m always going to be, Caroline. I’m going to take care of you. She protests but her passion is clearly overwhelming. His hand travels up her thigh, disappearing between her skirt. She moans. He leans in and tenderly kisses her neck then travels up to her lips. They kiss passionately.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Young Gus, is horrified. He takes a step back and the catwalk CREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Caroline and Steven jump, surprised. Caroline gathers herself.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's there? Caroline runs out. Steven looks around and stares straight at Present Day Gus before running out after his sister.

dialogues.speaker: THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Present Day Gus looks around at the empty theater. The set disappears as the memory fades. He stands alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus stands out of breath still reeling from the memory. He scrambles for his phone and dials.  84. An uneasy feeling begins to fall on Gus.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Mike?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike is walking thru the party, cell phone pressed to his ear. He’s opening doors, looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hang on. Let me find someplace quiet. He opens one last door, seeing an office, walks in.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: Mike closes the door behind him, the THUMPING music fading into background noise. It’s dark, he switches a desk lamp on.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m about to close a massive deal. It’s gonna put me back on top. Can we make this quick?

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I need you to remember Caroline Riordan. From Evergreen. Mike closes his eyes and thinks.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Doesn’t ring a bell.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (angry) . C'mon, this is important. Think! She killed herself. The door to the office opens, and the music SWELLS. Mike holds a finger up, not looking back - SOMEBODY’S entered the room.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to visitor) I’1l be with you in a second.  85. The door closes, and the music is muffled into background noise once more. Mike plays with a pendulum. Behind him a FIGURE stands waiting in the dark...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks on at the car, impatiently. Anna still sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Is someone there with you?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah I gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Wait! She had long dark hair. She was in theater. The same year as we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike begins to remember.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait, I do remember that chick. That crazy girl. (beat ) She drowned herself in the river. It was fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Man, she was a total slut. Slept with everyone. (beat ) Oh shit. She was fucking her brother! The FIGURE IN SHADOW shuffles, moves forward towards Mike.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: How could you forget something like that?  86.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It was so long ago. Who knows what’s true. Anyway, she died, end of story. No one cared. The FIGURE MOVES in CLOSER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus comes to a realization.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You told everyone! (beat ) It was you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Mike as Young Mike, on the phone. The FIGURE is just behind Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you man. That’s a shitty thing to say...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: But you did.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Maybe I told a few people. But I wasn’t the one that started it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus talks on the phone, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Then who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Gus walk their bikes, backpacks slung behind them. Gus has a pre-occupied look. He glances over to Mike.  87.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (serious, subdued) I gotta tell you something, but you gotta swear not to tell anyone. Mike nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Mike on the phone, the DARK FIGURE towering above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike’s silence cuts Gus like a cruel accusation. He nearly doubles over at the realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present day Mike holds the phone impatiently. The FIGURE behind Mike has his tie off, wrapped around his hands like piano wire. REVEAL: Steven lowers the tie around Mike’s neck strangles him. Mike drops his cell phone and grabs at the tie around his neck. Steven looks on focused, empowered by his passion and anger. Mike can only make choking noises as he struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus can hear the struggle on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Mike? Hello? Mike!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike slumps over the desk, dead. Gus’ voice can be heard thru the cell phone, calling out for him. Steven grabs the cell phone, in tears.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: My sister was not a slut. You hear me?!  88.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You sick son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Don’t feel too bad. Mike got what he deserved. Steven hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives numb and emotionless. Ann awakens. She looks at him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How long have I been asleep? Anna reaches out for him and touches his hand. Her touch pushes him over. He lets out a blood-curdling SCREAM. Anna just stares as he screams and screams, pounding the steering wheel, crying in anguish. CAMERA PULLS BACK thru the windshield, out of the car. We can still see Gus screaming, but we can no longer hear him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We view his violent outburst from outside the car but can only hear the incredible silence of the desolate road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna’s car drive up to motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna sit on the bed. She faces him, he faces the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You got locked up for twenty years for saying that?

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Whether it’s a pebble or a grain of sand in water they both sink alike.  89.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We beat the deadline.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow is the anniversary of her death.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: But that doesn’t matter. You wanted to know why. You have your answer. Now it’s over. Let’s just keep going. They stare into each others’ eyes, and it clearly affects Gus. Her earnestness grows. She senses that she may finally be reaching him - pushes further.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someplace he can’t find us. We can start over. You can walk away. He struggles to answer her, but instead turns away and steels himself. Anna waits for any sign from him for a beat, then resigns herself to his silence. After a few moments, she takes his arm, rests her head against his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna lie naked together in bed, post-coital deep sleep, her leg draped over his. ANGLE ON DOOR, as GAS seeps into the room through a crack at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: ECU on GAS MASK, a man’s face barely visible behind. It’s Steven and it looks like he’s smiling. He walks across the gas-filled room, to the bed where Anna and Gus sleep oblivious to his presence. He kneels down next to her, runs a finger along her exposed hip slowly sliding off what’s left of the covers, leaving her completely naked. Thru his gas mask, Steven’s breathing is loud and slow, like an astronaut exploring a new world.  90. He turns to look up at: LARRY standing by the door. He too wears a gas mask. In his hands he holds an elegantly wrapped gift box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has risen. It’s a new day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Gus hover over the strange gift box, bewildered by its presence. Gus cautiously opens it. CLOSE ON BOX: Sitting there on a velvet cushion, is a man’s severed HAND. We’1ll recognize the ostentatious ring as belonging to Toph. She stares at it a long beat, before collapsing on the ground unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives Mike’s jaguar back to the city. INT. MIKE’S CAR - DAY Gus is stonefaced. Anna looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We don’t have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: We have no choice. There’s no where safe for us. Until I end it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna walk through the hallway of Toph's public storage building. Toph's lackeys watch him pass by suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What are we doing here?  91. Gus doesn't answer, focused. Anna looks at him unsure. Gus walks on as Anna scurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anna enter the room followed by Toph's thugs. Toph sits with his back to them. Slowly, he swivels around to reveal that his hand has been replaced by a prosthetic. He looks at them, then subconsciously rubs his fake hand.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Alone. After staring into his eyes, Toph waves his prosthetic at his thugs, who grab onto Anna and lead her away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Gus. (to the thugs) Let go of me you assholes. Gus looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Go with them. The thugs lead her away, as she makes it difficult. When they're out of sight, Gus approaches Toph and takes a seat opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It looks like we've both got a score to settle. Gus gives him the ostentatious ring. Toph takes it, strokes it nostalgically.

dialogues.speaker: TOPH
dialogues.text: It appears that way.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Tell me where he is. Toph looks at him contemplating the request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus walks towards the exit alone. In the background, we hear Anna screaming and pleading.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t leave me here! Gus! Gus keeps walking, knows it’s for the best

dialogues.speaker: TOPH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: An enemy’s enemy is a friend, right (beat ) It’s in the theater district

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If I don’t come back by tomorrow, let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marquee lights and neon signs switch off one by one. The theater district is sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus heads towards a warehouse space transformed into a theater. The marquee on the building reads: MEDEA. Gus tries the door. It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus carefully enters the dimly lit theater lobby. He walks through the lobby passing stills from past productions. He hears voices inside the theater

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus enters the darkened theater. Spotlights are positioned on stage as a young woman stands there. He takes a closer look, focusing on the woman’s face. All he can see is the young and beautiful Caroline reciting lines.  93.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Come, flame by sky, Pierce through my head! What do I gain from living any longer? Oh how I hate living! I want to end my life, leave it behind, and die. She looks straight at him, piercing him with her dark eyes as though looking straight into his soul. He closes his eyes and looks again: The young woman is not Caroline at all just an actress rehearsing. Gus shakes his head trying to shake the image from his mind. STAGE MANAGER’S VOICE (v.0.) (thru P.A. system) That's it for today folks, see you for dress rehearsal tomorrow. Actors disperse. Gus looks around trying to spot Steven. Suddenly, we hear a pair of hands CLAPPING. The sound echoing in the empty theater. Gus looks around trying to spot the source. The lights go out. All that remains is the spotlight focused on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: From the darkness a dark figure emerges into the spotlight. Steven stands on stage CLAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You made it just in time. Furious, Gus runs up to the stage, bum-rushing Steven. He tackles him to the ground and starts pummeling him mercilessly. Steven doesn't make a move, not even to avoid being hit. Gus continues the onslaught of punches to Steve's face. Steven's head whips back as he spits out blood. Gus pauses trying to catch his breath. He seems animal- like.  94. Steve looks at him, bruised and bloody, works a smile on his lips. It looks like he may be enjoying this. STEVEN (CONT’D) Go ahead, kill me. Then you'll miss the best part. Gus gets up off him. Steven smiles through the blood.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: There's so much more for you to learn.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Fuck you! I don't want to know anymore.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Then why are you here? Steven disappears behind the curtains of the stage. Gus watches him go, cautious. Is this a trap?

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Gus walks through the backstage and sees a stairway. He looks up to see Steven at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Up here. Gus hesitates for a beat then follows up the stairs cautiously. Steven disappears into a door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus walks into a spacious penthouse apartment above the theater. We hear the somber tune of Mozart's Requiem. Gus looks around. The walls are adorned with framed pictures. On closer inspection, we see that the pictures are mostly of Caroline Riordan. At the center is a large striking picture of Caroline, trying to look happy. Behind her is a blurred picture of a river. Gus looks stares at the haunting picture. Steven gathers himself looking at a mirror, wiping the blood from his face.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I took that picture before she died.  95.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: You took my life from me. Killed the people I loved and for what? Because I started a stupid rumor? Steven laughs at the irony.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: A stupid rumor... (beat ) The rumor you started spread and spread, like a disease.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You weren't even around to see what you created.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: That mistake cost me everything. Steven looks at the framed picture of Caroline at the river. He touches it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I wasn't strong enough to hold on to her We zoom in on the picture as if comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Caroline's smiling face as the picture comes alive. As widen out to reveal that Caroline is leaning of the bridge ready to plunge in the river. Steven is holding on to her right hand, crying, trying to keep her from her falling. She dangles precariously over a shallow river, spotted with jagged rocks. A camera, dangles around his neck. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Don't cry. (beat ) Let me go.  96. Steven hangs on tighter.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Nooooo! She gathers a smile. With a her left hand she reaches over to the camera and clicks a picture of herself. The same picture now hanging on the loft.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Remember me. With that she unclasps her right hand, which begins to slip from Steven's grasp. He tries desperately to hold on but isn't strong enough. He loses his grip and she falls. Steven's POV of Caroline falling to the river below on her back, as if she's floating peacefully. He screams after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven looks at his hands. Gus looks on guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Is that what you want? Steven looks at him furious.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: The time for apologies is long over. Steven walks to his laptop and whirls it around towards Gus. Gus approaches the laptop and sees a window with an image. A surveillance video pointed into the storage room. In the room sits Anna

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sits on the bed staring at the clock. She looks over to her suitcase and pulls it towards her.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus looks at the image on the screen, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: You underestimated me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toph's strapped to a chair, with his right arm exposed. One of his thugs let him drink from a bottle of whiskey. Steven looks on in a corner, stoic. Toph takes a deep breath and nods to Steven.

dialogues.speaker: TOPH
dialogues.text: (gritting it) Get it fucking over with. Steven nods to another thug next to him who takes out a hack saw. The thug approaches Toph and begins to saw off his arm. Toph screams in pain.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I worked my whole life to make money that means nothing to me.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: But it shouldn’t surprise me how far people will go to get what they really want. These words ring in Gus's head. He doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: She has nothing to do with this. Let her go. Steven spins around, furious. He slams his fist ona table, cracking the glass facade.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: She has everything to do with this.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna searches through her suitcase. Suddenly, the door opens and Toph walks in carrying a large gift box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus watches from the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I swear to god if you hurt her...

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: That's all up to you. Steven’s bodyguard LARRY enters holding an ornate photo album. He hands it to Steven. Steven leafs through it. STEVEN (cont’d) You care about her don't you? Gus doesn't answer. STEVEN (CONT'D) (cont’d) It was so perfect. I spent so much time thinking about how I would do it. Make you feel the pain that I did. Then it hit. It was so perfect.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Steven hands Gus the photo album. Gus looks at it, but doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Take it! Larry stands nearby, arms folded across his chest. Slowly, Gus's hand reaches out for the album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toph now sits on a chair by the bed. We see that he wears a holster with a gun.  99. Anna eyes the gun the gazes at the gift box he's placed by him. She continues to rummage through her suitcase finds what she's looking for. She takes out a wrinkled brown paper bag from her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus takes the album and opens the first page. A newborn baby. Gus turns the page, pictures of Gus’s wife Kayla and Gus holding the baby. Gus begins to cry, seeing these images, revisiting old pain. He flips the page: more pictures of the baby, now wearing ANGEL WINGS. Then as a toddler on Christmas morning. Then as a little girl learning to ride a bike.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: There's something about her. You must have felt it right away... Gus turns another page. Pictures of the girl as a teen. STEVEN (CONT'D) (cont’d) As if you've known her all your life. Gus's face becomes grim. A slow realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna pulls the contents of the brown paper bag. Something discernible...something white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, scared, turns to the final pages. A prom picture. Gus’s face goes ashen. The girl in the photos is ANNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna sits on the bed. The angel's wings strapped to her back like a security blanket.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus crumbles to the ground in tears, broken. The room is spinning and he dry heaves.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I've made you fall in love. Gus clutches at his stomach, reeling in the fact that he's slept with his own daughter.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Now you know how I feel. Steven gets up and takes out a gun. Gus stares at it with a look of dread and longing. Steven smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: I'm not going to kill you. He sets the gun down next to Gus and walks away. He heads for his picture. STEVEN (cont’d) In the box next to Anna is that same album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna, wearing the angel's wings, looks at the gift by her side. She puts a hand to it. She looks at Toph. Toph looks at the clock and shakes his head 'no.' She lifts her hands off the box and waits. Anna returns her gaze to the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus gets a look of rage. He curls his fingers into fists as he storms behind Steven. That’s when Larry steps in blocking his path. Gus throws several punches, but Larry is a seasoned fighter. They crash into each other like fierce animals. Larry brings Gus to the ground, trying to choke him out. But Gus outmaneuvers him, and gains leverage.  101. He jabs Larry in the throat, wrenches his arm too far to the left - SNAP! Larry isn’t giving up, grabs a clump of Gus’ hair. Gus head-butts him, causing blood to gush from Larry’s nose. He leaves Larry on the ground squirming scrambles to pick up the gun but Steven has it in his hands. He points it at Gus’s head. He motions for Gus to get up on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Please, I'm begging you. Don't show it to her. This is all my fault. Don't punish her. Gus gets up, defeated...blubbering.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat ) I'll do anything. Anything you want. Steven looks away from him and back to the picture. Steven stares into Caroline's eyes - a flash of anger that subsides as quickly as it came. Steven wraps his arm around Gus as they stand side by side facing opposite directions. Steven points the gun to Gus’s temple. One bullet and they both die.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: The only thing I did wrong was to love her, Gus. Gus opens his eyes, stops trembling.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We loved each other and we were willing to live with that fact. (beat ) Now the question is, can you? Steven picks up the phone with his free hand and dials. He waits a beat until someone on the other line picks up.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Let her go... Hearing these words sparks Gus into action. He grabs the gun from Steven - and in the blink of an eye - spins around and pulls the trigger. The bullet flies through the air and lands in Steven’s head - flies out the other end.  102. For a moment, there is nothing bus silence. Gus and Steven stare at each other, a moment of unity and understanding. Steven’s face looks serene as if he’s finally reached some inner peace. He falls back, dead. Gus stands there with the gun still smoking in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toph hears nothing but silence over the phone. He reaches for the gift box, hesitates. Then he lifts the cover. She takes out the album. Toph gets up off the chair and pulls out a train ticket from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TOPH
dialogues.text: If I were you, I'd go as far away from here as possible. He throws the ticket on the bed and exits leaving the door wide open. Anna flips through the pages of the book

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus drives alone in a jeep down a rural country road. Trees, mountains, peace.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Too many questions to answer, so I left them all behind. INT. GUS’ JEEP Gus’ hair has gone completely grey. His eyes have lost a bit of their former ferocity. His face is wrinkled, world-weary.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But wherever I went the questions followed. What is happiness? What is love? Where do we lay our hearts to rest and move on with our lives?  103. He turns up a small side road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small town diner. Anna, again working as a waitress, takes an order. There’s something different about her. She looks older, more mature, a bit distant — sadness lingers in her eyes. The BELLS of the door ring, signalling a new customer entering. She turns towards the door and sees... Gus, who also looks older and a bit worn down. They regard each other for a bit, not moving, not saying anything. He looks at her, longingly. He's torn by his decision but knows he can’t stay away. FADE TO BLACK.
